entry.title: Eustace Tilley (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2017, Eustace Tilley (pictured) missed his annual turn on the cover of The New Yorker because of Donald Trump?

entry.title: tomb of Khan Muhammad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the British period, the tomb of Khan Muhammad was used as an office and residence for the executive engineer?

entry.title: Lou Daukas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after his professional American football career, Lou Daukas became a lawyer?

entry.title: Convent of Saint Lazarus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the thought of her sister Ioveta being a common nun was so abhorrent to the queen of Jerusalem that she ordered the construction of the Convent of Saint Lazarus for Ioveta to rule as an abbess?

entry.title: the great-nephew of Leon Trotsky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the great-nephew of Leon Trotsky was a physician for the Black Panther Party and helped deinstitutionalize Willowbrook State School?

entry.title: Musical Instrument Bank (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the entire inventory of historic string instruments in Canada's Musical Instrument Bank are loaned to musicians in a competition held every three years?

entry.title: Stephen Badlam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that cabinet-maker Stephen Badlam simultaneously served as a justice of the peace and a brigadier-general?

entry.title: crested cuckoo-dove (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that misidentifications of the crested cuckoo-dove have led to claims that the extinct Choiseul pigeon is still around?
